title: Important Notice: Temporary Service Impact
shortDescription: SACPVP has encountered an unforeseen challenge that may temporarily impact response times. Alternative arrangements are being implemented.
content:
Dear Registered Persons

Please be advised that the South African Council for the Property Valuers Profession (SACPVP) has encountered an unforeseen challenge, which may temporarily impact our response time to correspondence and service requests.

Please be assured that SACPVP is actively implementing alternative arrangements to address this matter and minimise any inconvenience. We remain committed to maintaining the standard of service expected by our registered persons and will keep you informed of progress in resolving the situation.

We sincerely apologise for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience and understanding during this period.

title: 2025 PRACTICAL WORKSCHOOL DIRECTION
shortDescription: Detailed directions and travel information for the 2025 Practical Workschool venue at Kopanong Hotel.
content:
Please find below the detailed directions to the 2025 Practical Workschool venue at Kopanong Hotel. We recommend reviewing these directions before your departure to ensure timely arrival.

From Pretoria:
Take the R21 (South) Highway towards OR Tambo International Airport, take the Benoni off-ramp, turn left at the top of the off-ramp, follow the road to the traffic light, at The Engen garage turn left onto the M32, go through three sets of traffic lights and a stop sign. At the stop sign keep straight, drive ¬± 400 meters and turn right at the next traffic light into Glen Gory Road. After turning right, drive approximately 400 meters and Kopanong Hotel is located on the left hand side.

From Johannesburg:
Take the most convenient route towards OR Tambo International Airport (R24 Highway), then follow the R21 (North) Highway towards Pretoria, pass Kempton Park & Atlas off-ramps and take the third off-ramp after the Airport, being Pomona. Turn right at the top of the off-ramp at the traffic light, follow the M32 for 8.5km, (you will go through four sets of traffic lights and a stop sign. At the stop sign keep straight, drive ¬± 400 meters and turn right at the next traffic light into Glen Gory Road. After turning right, drive approximately 400 meters and Kopanong Hotel is located on the left hand side.

N12 East:
Take the N12 to Benoni, pass the East Rand Mall Shopping Centre, and pass the Atlas Road Off-ramp and take the next off-ramp, Tom Jones. Turn left at the traffic light (you are now in Bunyan Road which becomes the Great North Road). Proceed with the Great North Road (3km), at the 7th traffic light (this includes one pedestrian light), turn right into Oak Street. Go through two 4-way stops and pass the Oakfield's Pick'n Pay Shopping Centre on your right hand side. Keep travelling straight on Oak Street, the road name changes to Benoni Road, which becomes Glen Gory Road. From the traffic light at the BP Station, Kopanong Hotel is 4km down the road on your right.

For any queries regarding directions or the venue, please contact the SAIV office.

title: V20 Summit & Conference 2025
shortDescription: Join us for the prestigious V20 Valuation Summit and Conference 2025 in Cape Town, South Africa.
content:
We are excited to announce that the V20 Valuation Summit and Conference 2025 will be held in South Africa, following its successful editions in India in 2023 and Brazil in 2024.

This year's theme is 'Valuation for Solidarity, Inclusion, and Sustainability: A Pathway to Global Harmony and Development.'

Event Details:
- Date: 15-16 September 2025
- Venue: Cape Town International Convention Centre (CTICC), South Africa
- Recommended Accommodation: Hotel Sky

This prestigious event will gather a large number of professionals, including valuation experts, corporate leaders, regulators, and decision-makers from across South Africa and abroad. The conference will offer engaging presentations, insightful discussions, and invaluable networking opportunities aimed at advancing the valuation profession and fostering collaboration.

Sponsorship Categories:
- Platinum: R250,000 ($15,000)
- Gold: R185,000 ($10,000)
- Silver: R95,000 ($5,000)
- Bronze: R50,000 ($2,500)

For more information, please contact SAIV Head Office:
Tel: 011 642 7266
Email: info@saiv.org.za

title: 2025-2026 Examination Information
shortDescription: Important information regarding the upcoming professional examinations for the 2025-2026 academic year.
content:
The South African Institute of Valuers is pleased to announce the examination schedule for the 2025-2026 academic year.

Examination Details:
- Registration opens: January 15, 2025
- Registration closes: March 31, 2025
- Examination dates: June 2025 and November 2025
- Results release: Within 8 weeks of examination

Candidates are advised to review the examination guidelines and ensure all prerequisites are met before registration. Study materials and preparation courses will be available through our approved education providers.

- National Diploma (NQF Level 6) or Degree (NQF Level 7) in Property Valuation or relevant equivalent
- Registered as a Professional Valuer or Professional Associated Valuer (no restrictions)
- 5 years' experience in municipal valuations
- Valid Code B or EB Driver‚Äôs License

Key Responsibilities:

title: Announcement of New SACPVP Council Members
shortDescription: Two new members appointed to the 6th Council of the SACPVP following recent resignations.
content:
Following the resignation of two members from the 6th Council of the South African Council for the Property Valuers Profession (SACPVP), the Honourable Minister Mr. D Macpherson has appointed two new Council members.

These appointments are effective immediately and will remain in place until September 2026.

The updated 6th Council now includes:
- Mr. John Frederick Cloete (President)
- Ms. Tiny Dlamini (Vice President)
- Ms. Mankuroane Matseba
- Mr. Manyane Chidi
- Ms. Rehab Letsaba
- Ms. Hendrina Viljoen
- Mr. Gregory Cowden
- Mr. Rakesh Ramlugaan
- Mr. JF du Toit (Saul)
- Mr. MPL Mthuli (Malusi)

The announcement also includes the appointment of new administrative staff to strengthen Council operations.

title: September 2025 Board Examination Rescheduled
shortDescription: The September Board Exam has been rescheduled to 25 September 2025. Applicable only to registered persons who applied.
content:
To All Registered Ca Val & Pr Aval

The September Board examination has been re-scheduled to 25th September 2025 due to several requests from Registered Persons attending the V20 Summit and Conference, 2 days prior in Cape Town. (i.e. on the 15th and 16th).

The assessment of the applications to write the Board examination will be completed before the end of next week and the outcomes will be communicated thereafter.

We would like to apologise for the delay of releasing the outcome of your application to write the Board Exam.

Please note: This message is meant only for the Registered persons who have applied to write the Board Exam on 25 September 2025.
